intro: Fumana oligosperma, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Fumana oligosperma is known for its milky sap, which is a common feature among members of its family. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas.
